com.andoverrobotics.core.utilities

Interface IMotor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MotorAdapter, MotorPair

    public interface IMotor
    Represents an entity or a set of entities that can be controlled like a motor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addTargetPosition(int tickOffset)
      Adds the given offset to the current position, and sets that sum as the target position.
      boolean isBusy()
      Tells if any motor is busy.
      void setMode(DcMotor.RunMode mode)
      Sets the DcMotor.RunMode of the motor(s).
      void setPower(double power)
      Sets the power of the motor(s).
      void startRunToPosition(int tickOffset, double absPower)
      Starts moving to the specified target position with the given power.

    • Method Detail

      • setPower

        void setPower(double power)
        Sets the power of the motor(s).
        Parameters:
        power - The new power

      • addTargetPosition

        void addTargetPosition(int tickOffset)
        Adds the given offset to the current position, and sets that sum as the target position.
        Parameters:
        tickOffset - The offset that is added to the current position

      • startRunToPosition

        void startRunToPosition(int tickOffset,
                        double absPower)
        Starts moving to the specified target position with the given power.
        Parameters:
        tickOffset - The number of ticks to travel, which specifies the direction and distance of travel
        absPower - The absolute value of the power to assign to the motors

      • setMode

        void setMode(DcMotor.RunMode mode)
        Sets the DcMotor.RunMode of the motor(s).
        Parameters:
        mode - The new DcMotor.RunMode

      • isBusy

        boolean isBusy()
        Tells if any motor is busy.
        Returns:
        True if any motor is busy
